Had a guy insta lock top after we already had a top laner. Instead of crying, everyone just played normally and the duo top's decided once they hit level 4 to do jungle camps and gank other lanes together.

Worked out pretty well.

Bottom line is: its a game, its a normal, but most importantly GAMES ARE FOR FUN.
You want to play meta roles and everyone be super serious all the time, play ranked.

I have to agree with you. I get that you can't tell people how to play and that the 'meta' is only an invisible theory that most try to enforce, but at the end of the day, it's a team game and your own version of 'fun' isn't fun for others. Griefing others and saying it's only a norm, is a b.s. cop out to make it look like your anti-team, griefing antics are acceptable. I don't always want to play ranked. I still want to win at normals. Or at least have a decent game. I mean you spend 10 minutes getting into a game, with champ select, dodgers, load time, and then at very least 20 minutes playing the game (unless you want to quit and get leaver bustered), so no, I don't want to be a part of your troll game. Either ask me if I want to have a troll game first, so I can dodge, or go play customs if you don't care. But they won't, because the only reason they troll in matchmade games is to piss others off.
